page.title: 05Use of the Welsh Language
page.content: The Welsh language is in daily use by a very large number of the population.Many older people use English only when they must,and great efforts are made to re-inforce the use of Welsh from an early age in schools.This means that many of the children are bi-lingual. Gwynedd County Council subsidises adult classes in Welsh. Many church and chapel services are in Welsh. Llanrwst holds an annual Eisteddfod. All official notices,place names on sign posts and accounts from public sources such as rates, water rates,gas,electricity,telephones etc.,are submitted in Welsh and English. Television's Channel Four in this district is the largely Welsh version S4C, and the English version is not broadcast locally.
